categories.name: Industrial Design
categories.description:
I firmly believe in the principle of "form follows function" guiding my pursuit of aesthetic solutions that never compromise functionality. However, I never overlook the importance of the emotional component that makes us human. Each of my projects aims to create an emotional connection between the user and the product, enhancing the everyday experience through intuitive and engaging design.

My experience has enabled me to develop a minimalist approach, where every element is essential and contributes to a harmonious and functional whole. This balance between aesthetics, functionality, and emotion defines my work and my design philosophy.

categories.name: UX Design
categories.description: My journey into user experience design (UX Design) began with the realization that every interaction between a user and a product should be intuitive and satisfying. I have spent years studying and applying best practices in user research, interface design, information architecture, and prototyping. My goal has always been to create digital and physical products that not only meet the needs of end users but also significantly enhance their overall experience. Each project has been an opportunity to refine my skills and contribute to making the world a bit more user-friendly.

categories.name: Development
categories.description: My passion for software development has led me to explore and master various programming languages and tools. I have had the opportunity to work on projects ranging from web applications to mobile and desktop applications. Each phase of development, from requirement definition to coding, testing, and debugging, has allowed me to grow professionally.

categories.name: Teaching
categories.description: Teaching has always been a fundamental part of my career. I have had the privilege of sharing my knowledge and skills with students of all ages, in both formal and informal settings. I have conducted corporate training courses on HTML, CSS, Angular, Postgres, Java, Spring, and web accessibility, and I have also had the opportunity to teach design to children at SOUx Bitonto. Each lesson has been an opportunity to engage students and facilitate active learning using a variety of teaching methodologies. My goal has always been not only to impart theoretical knowledge but also to develop students' critical and practical skills, preparing them for their future professional and personal lives.

My goal has always been to create digital and physical products that not only meet the needs of end users but also significantly enhance their overall experience. Each project has been an opportunity to refine my skills and contribute to making the world a bit more user-friendly.

I have had the opportunity to work on projects ranging from web applications to mobile and desktop applications. Each phase of development, from requirement definition to coding, testing, and debugging, has allowed me to grow professionally.

categories.name: Teaching
categories.description: Teaching has always been a fundamental part of my career. I have had the privilege of sharing my knowledge and skills with students of all ages, in both formal and informal settings. I have conducted corporate training courses on HTML, CSS, Angular, Postgres, Java, Spring, and web accessibility, and I have also had the opportunity to teach design to children at SOUx Bitonto. projects.name: Utensilia
projects.description:
During my second year of the Bachelor's program in Industrial Design at the University of Bari, I participated in the "Utensilia" project. The objective was to analyze and redesign the tools used by a local artisan, Gino Macci, who crafts paper hot air balloons launched during patronal festivals in Capurso and surrounding areas as a divine tribute.
We developed several innovative tools to enhance his craft. "Maccio" is a tool designed to clean the dirty bristles of the brush used for decorations. "Twistello" is a brush equipped with an iris gear mechanism that allows the bristles to change density, thus adjusting precision. "Simmetrica" is a device capable of cutting the balloon panels by inputting only the balloon's height and the desired number of panels. "Traccia" is a metal tool that facilitates the creation of radial decorations. Lastly, "WuitsAir" is a device attached to the balloons that, upon detecting a certain altitude, opens valves to deflate the balloon for recovery.

projects.name: Project Woop - Branding
projects.description:
Personal branding project. Its origin is connected to an years-long unconscious story, but its final form is a totally defined identity.
The logo is both simple and recognizable, working well in every occasion. The similarity to a human eye has made it possible to make it a 3D mascotte, and its simpleness can generate a lot of variations all equally loyal to the design language.
 The name is short and of impact. Woop is difficult to forget as a sound and implicitly makes you think about something future oriented, innovative.

projects.name: SPAZIOTEMPO
projects.description: The collection is composed of four elements: a chair, a table, a clock, and a lighting system. Anima, Bubbly, Relativo, and Breath come together to explore the illusions of the beliefs that live with us, playing with space and time and showcasing the reality and fiction of the dimensions in which we exist. Anima is inspired by the classic seats of modern design, distorting their reality through transparent elements that create a contrast of spaces. Bubbly draws inspiration from abstractionism, with a bubble enveloping the metal top of the table, communicating lightness and then a sense of weight. Relativo is a clock with hands of equal length that move uncoordinatedly, suggesting the non-existence of time as a measurable concept. Breath represents the movement produced by the lighting system, with a light bulb floating inside a transparent shell, creating plays of shadows and reflections that emphasize the characteristics of the space.

projects.name: Marasma
projects.description: Marasma blends chaos and order in a seemingly discordant manner. In nature, chaos manifests in various forms, yet upon closer examination, an underlying order emerges. Marasma seeks to invert this perception. At its core lies a perfect geometric shape: a cube, reminiscent of an orderly grid. However, this plane is supported by elements arranged chaotically, defying immediate comprehension. Only through meticulous study of each cube does an internal schema of order reveal itself, making the structure possible.

projects.name: Oltremodo
projects.description: Oltremodo is a collection that leverages the simplest production techniques to achieve elegance. By merely bending and cutting sheet metal or tubular metal, the collection includes a chair in two different form factors, a table, and a set of cutlery and crockery.

projects.name: Acida
projects.description:
Made just for fun, it’s indeed a fun looking stool which can be very versatile and comfortable.
With its vivid colors and nature-inspired form, it sparks joy and can be the core of a visually distinguishing space.
The structure is made of polycarbonate with a soft seat on top, the footrest is a shiny tubular metal and the backrest is made of a translucent plastic capable of revolve around the base.

projects.name: Phone 1
projects.description: One of my most serious early projects is a phone with a unique design that defies market trends, making it stand out. The camera is particularly noteworthy. Instead of maximizing the number of cameras, I opted for a single sensor and utilized the phone's entire height to enhance its features. By allowing the lens to move along the phone's length, it replicates the functionality of a DSLR in a slim form factor. This concept was so innovative that Apple patented a similar technology years later.

projects.name: Razer Phone 2
projects.description: In this project, I explored ways to make the back of a phone functional for gaming by incorporating a touchpad that can be used for aiming in shooter games or unlocking additional features in exclusive titles. For the rest of the redesign, I adhered closely to Razer's original design language. I shared images of the concept with numerous online magazines and influencers, and some began to speculate that this might be the actual Razer Phone 2. Based on the feedback and comments received, the concept was well-received.

projects.name: Cyber Sink
projects.description: In 2019, Tesla unveiled what is arguably the most controversial truck ever created. I admired its boldness. Therefore, I decided to apply the same distinctive design language to a sink. This sink features unique elements, such as two knobs—one for pressure and one for temperature—that can maintain a consistent water temperature, as well as Qi charging bases for charging devices like the Cyber Toothbrush Mk I. Additionally, the project includes a smart mirror capable of displaying the most useful information for your day.

projects.name: Flusso
projects.description: A wall lamp with a minimalist design that requires physical interaction to be turned on. The light-emitting body must be manually lifted for it to start illuminating. The lamp features a continuous dimming system, meaning the brightness increases proportionally to the height at which the light-emitting body is raised.

projects.name: Gravità
projects.description: The Gravità table lamp requires physical interaction to turn on the light. Despite its unique functionality, Gravità offers a natural user experience that goes beyond mere illumination. When off, a shiny metal ball is visible on its base. The upper part resembles an inverted cone, inviting the user to throw the ball inside. This action closes a low voltage circuit, turning on the light. To turn it off, lift the pipes to let the ball fall back onto the base, opening the circuit and extinguishing the light.

projects.name: SottoSopra app
projects.description:
Working at Overzoom, I’ve made the app responsible to keep track of the work in progress railway burial of my city, Andria.
I’ve made firstly the UI/UX project, curing every visual aspect, then developed the app itself using Flutter.

projects.name: Orange Charge app
projects.description: Orange Charge is an app thanks to which you can charge your electric vehicle via the Orange Network. Like every project done in Overzoom, I’ve first made the UX/UI project then developed the whole app. For this project I’ve also done the back-end responsible of communicating with the chargeboxes in NodeJS.

projects.name: BachecApp & FollowApp
projects.description: Two really complete projects done in Overzoom, in which I’ve cured the whole branding and design language, then made the UX/UI part for both the mobile app and the desktop back-office and finally developed mobile app in Flutter, back-end in NodeJS and back-office in ReactJS.

projects.name: Reraise app
projects.description:
App made for a professional poker room based in Barletta. In Overzoom, I’ve been able to design and develop an app capable of register new users and make them do all they need in the poker room via their personal QR-Code. 
The app also shows personal infos like personal points, tickets and the jackpot. It also features a live section where you can watch on-going tournaments and their real-time infos.

projects.name: Overzoom UI
projects.description: Every great brand that wants to stand out needs an impactful visual coherence. Big brands put a lot of efforts into making their User Interfaces well recognizable, familiar and efficient. For Overzoom, I’ve designed a UI kit that shapes the future of the company products, improving by a lot the quality of the softwares developed.
